Table.name: INV_INV
Table.commentInRDBMS: Inventory: This class contains all inventory. This is the most generalized inventory structure in the model. It enumerates the current configuration of all inventory and provides the structure of assemblies through the recursive hierarchical links to the next highest, highest and next highest assembly. This tree is pruned and grafted with each completed configuration change transaction. This is the primary source for the Technical Log.

Column.name: INV_NO_DB_ID
Column.commentInRDBMS: Identifies the creation database (MIM_LOCAL_DB) of the record and forms part of the record's primary key.

Column.name: INV_NO_ID
Column.commentInRDBMS: Unique identifier assigned from Sequence INV_NO_ID_SEQ.

Column.name: INV_CLASS_DB_ID
Column.commentInRDBMS: FK to REF_INV_CLASS. Identifies the class of the inventory, which is used to activate various Maintenix functionality.

Column.name: INV_CLASS_CD
Column.commentInRDBMS: FK to REF_INV_CLASS. Identifies the class of the inventory, which is used to activate various Maintenix functionality.

Column.name: BOM_PART_DB_ID
Column.commentInRDBMS: FK to EQP_BOM_PART. This identifies the bill of material item which the given part number is an alternate for.

Column.name: BOM_PART_ID
Column.commentInRDBMS: FK to EQP_BOM_PART. This identifies the bill of material item which the given part number is an alternate for.

Column.name: LOC_DB_ID
Column.commentInRDBMS: FK to INV_LOC. Represents the geographic location where the location is stored.

Column.name: LOC_ID
Column.commentInRDBMS: FK to INV_LOC. Represents the geographic location where the location is stored.

Column.name: PART_NO_DB_ID
Column.commentInRDBMS: FK to EQP_PART_NO. The part number which this inventory item is an instance of.

Column.name: PART_NO_ID
Column.commentInRDBMS: FK to EQP_PART_NO. The part number which this inventory item is an instance of.

Column.name: AUTHORITY_DB_ID
Column.commentInRDBMS: FK to ORG_AUTHORITY.

Column.name: AUTHORITY_ID
Column.commentInRDBMS: FK to ORG_AUTHORITY.

Column.name: H_INV_NO_DB_ID
Column.commentInRDBMS: FK to INV_INV. Identifies the highest inventory. Since inventory are organized hierarchically, this value indicates the "highest" inventory in the tree. A root inventory always has a reference to itself.

Column.name: H_INV_NO_ID
Column.commentInRDBMS: FK to INV_INV. Identifies the highest inventory. Since inventory are organized hierarchically, this value indicates the "highest" inventory in the tree. A root inventory always has a reference to itself.

Column.name: ASSMBL_INV_NO_DB_ID
Column.commentInRDBMS: FK to INV_INV. Identifies the parent assembly inventory. Since inventory are organized hierarchically, this value indicates the "next highest inventory of type assembly" in the tree. If this is a loose assembly item, then this will be a reference to itself. If this inventory item is not currently installed on an assembly, then this will be NULL.

Column.name: ASSMBL_INV_NO_ID
Column.commentInRDBMS: FK to INV_INV. Identifies the parent assembly inventory. Since inventory are organized hierarchically, this value indicates the "next highest inventory of type assembly" in the tree. If this is a loose assembly item, then this will be a reference to itself. If this inventory item is not currently installed on an assembly, then this will be NULL.

Column.name: NH_INV_NO_DB_ID
Column.commentInRDBMS: FK to INV_INV. Identifies the parent inventory. Since inventory are organized hierarchically, this value indicates the "next highest" inventory in the tree. A root inventory always has a value of NULL.

Column.name: NH_INV_NO_ID
Column.commentInRDBMS: FK to INV_INV. Identifies the parent inventory. Since inventory are organized hierarchically, this value indicates the "next highest" inventory in the tree. A root inventory always has a value of NULL.

Column.name: VENDOR_DB_ID
Column.commentInRDBMS: FK to ORG_VENDOR. The vendor from which this inventory item was purchased.

Column.name: VENDOR_ID
Column.commentInRDBMS: FK to ORG_VENDOR. The vendor from which this inventory item was purchased.

Column.name: INV_COND_DB_ID
Column.commentInRDBMS: FK to REF_INV_COND. The condition of the inventory. This is used by maintenance personnel to determine whether inventory is serviceable or not.

Column.name: INV_COND_CD
Column.commentInRDBMS: FK to REF_INV_COND. The condition of the inventory. This is used by maintenance personnel to determine whether inventory is serviceable or not.

Column.name: ASSMBL_DB_ID
Column.commentInRDBMS: FK to EQP_ASSMBL_POS. This is used by log card inventory (ie. inv_class_cd = "LOG"). It identifies the log card position that this inventory is currently being used for.

Column.name: ASSMBL_CD
Column.commentInRDBMS: FK to EQP_ASSMBL_POS. This is used by log card inventory (ie. inv_class_cd = "LOG"). It identifies the log card position that this inventory is currently being used for.

Column.name: ASSMBL_BOM_ID
Column.commentInRDBMS: FK to EQP_ASSMBL_POS. This is used by log card inventory (ie. inv_class_cd = "LOG"). It identifies the log card position that this inventory is currently being used for.

Column.name: ASSMBL_POS_ID
Column.commentInRDBMS: FK to EQP_ASSMBL_POS. This is used by log card inventory (ie. inv_class_cd = "LOG"). It identifies the log card position that this inventory is currently being used for.

Column.name: ORIG_ASSMBL_DB_ID
Column.commentInRDBMS: FK to EQP_ASSMBL. This is used by assembly inventory (inv_class_cd = "ASSY"). It identifies the assembly which this inventory item represents.

Column.name: ORIG_ASSMBL_CD
Column.commentInRDBMS: FK to EQP_ASSMBL. This is used by assembly inventory (inv_class_cd = "ASSY"). It identifies the assembly which this inventory item represents.

Column.name: ASSMBL_SUBTYPE_DB_ID
Column.commentInRDBMS: FK to EQP_ASSMBL_SUBTYPE. Identifies the subtype of the assembly (ACFT only.)

Column.name: ASSMBL_SUBTYPE_ID
Column.commentInRDBMS: FK to EQP_ASSMBL_SUBTYPE. Identifies the subtype of the assembly (ACFT only.)

Column.name: OWNER_DB_ID
Column.commentInRDBMS: FK to INV_OWNER. Identifies the owner of the inventory item.

Column.name: OWNER_ID
Column.commentInRDBMS: FK to INV_OWNER. Identifies the owner of the inventory item.

Column.name: RECEIVE_COND_DB_ID
Column.commentInRDBMS: FK to REF_RECEIVED_COND.

Column.name: RECEIVE_COND_CD
Column.commentInRDBMS: FK to REF_RECEIVED_COND.

Column.name: INV_NO_SDESC
Column.commentInRDBMS: A name used to label the item.

Column.name: ICN_NO_SDESC
Column.commentInRDBMS: The inventory control number. It is used as an alternate, organization-specific serial number for the item.

Column.name: SERIAL_NO_OEM
Column.commentInRDBMS: The original equipment manufacturer's serial number.

Column.name: LOT_OEM_TAG
Column.commentInRDBMS: The original equipment manufacturer's lot number for this batch of parts.

Column.name: MANUFACT_DT
Column.commentInRDBMS: The date the item was manufactured.

Column.name: PO_REF_SDESC
Column.commentInRDBMS: A reference to the purchase order tag under which this inventory item was bought.

Column.name: RECEIVED_DT
Column.commentInRDBMS: The date the part was received by the current owner.

Column.name: INSTALL_DT
Column.commentInRDBMS: The date the part was installed.

Column.name: INSTALL_GDT
Column.commentInRDBMS: The GMT for the item's installation.

Column.name: USED_BOOL
Column.commentInRDBMS: Indicates if the part was used when it entered service.

Column.name: COMPLETE_BOOL
Column.commentInRDBMS: Indicates if all sub-logcards are currently installed in the structure.

Column.name: LOCKED_BOOL
Column.commentInRDBMS: Indicates if the user has locked the item (and all of its sub-items).

Column.name: RESERVED_BOOL
Column.commentInRDBMS: Indicator of whether the inventory item is reserved or not. This is only applicable for serialized inventory.

Column.name: PICKED_BOOL
Column.commentInRDBMS: This field when true shows that inventory have been picked for shipement.

Column.name: SEVERITY_CD
Column.commentInRDBMS: The severity of the item.

Column.name: BARCODE_SDESC
Column.commentInRDBMS: User entered barcode. Used for equipment that already has a barcode or RFID identification built in.

Column.name: NOTE
Column.commentInRDBMS: Any miscellaneous note for the inventory item

Column.name: BIN_QT
Column.commentInRDBMS: The number of items in this batch. This attribute is only used by batch and quantity controlled inventory (inv_class_cd=BATCH or QTY)

Column.name: SHELF_EXPIRY_DT
Column.commentInRDBMS: This column is used to indicate the shelf life expiry date for a piece of inventory.

Column.name: RESERVE_QT
Column.commentInRDBMS: The number of reserved items in a batch.

Column.name: BATCH_NO_OEM
Column.commentInRDBMS: This column is used to record the OEM Batch No of an inventory item. This is commonly used for batch inventory, although it is also possible to specify an OEM Batch No for a serialized component.

Column.name: FINANCE_STATUS_CD
Column.commentInRDBMS: Indicates whether the inventory item has been counted as an inventory asset.

Column.name: PO_DB_ID
Column.commentInRDBMS: FK PO_LINE.

Column.name: PO_ID
Column.commentInRDBMS: FK PO_LINE.

Column.name: PO_LINE_ID
Column.commentInRDBMS: FK PO_LINE.

Column.name: APPL_EFF_CD
Column.commentInRDBMS: This is the applicability code for an assembly inventory

Column.name: ISSUED_BOOL
Column.commentInRDBMS: Indicates whether or not the inventory has been issued or not.

Column.name: NOT_FOUND_BOOL
Column.commentInRDBMS: If the storeroom clerks cannot find an inventory item, they will temporarily mark it as Not Found.

Column.name: CTRL_DB_ID
Column.commentInRDBMS: Used for replicated db's only.

Column.name: PREVENT_SYNCH_BOOL
Column.commentInRDBMS: This boolean indicates that the inventory item should not be automatically synchronized. This should only be set to true for highest level inventory.

Column.name: RELEASE_REMARKS_LDESC
Column.commentInRDBMS: inventory release remarks. Used inspecting an inventory item as servicable.

Column.name: RELEASE_NUMBER_SDESC
Column.commentInRDBMS: release number associated with an inventory item.

Column.name: RELEASE_DT
Column.commentInRDBMS: release date of inventory.

Column.name: CONFIG_POS_SDESC
Column.commentInRDBMS: This is the config position description for an inventory

Column.name: ALT_ID
Column.commentInRDBMS:
The alternate key is useful for identifying a specific row in the database when dealing with integrations and Maintenix front ends. The alternate key can is unique to each entity and acts as a surrogate key.

The alternate key is intended to be system generated.

Column.name: RSTAT_CD
Column.commentInRDBMS: A physical attribute that defines the read/write access of the record.

Column.name: CREATION_DT
Column.commentInRDBMS: The database server's timestamp captured at the time the record was inserted.

Column.name: REVISION_DT
Column.commentInRDBMS: The database server's timestamp captured at the time the record was last updated.

Column.name: REVISION_DB_ID
Column.commentInRDBMS: The database identifier (MIM_LOCAL_DB) captured at the time the record was last updated. Identifies where modifications are being made in distributed Maintenix.

Column.name: REVISION_USER
Column.commentInRDBMS: The user that last modified the record. The user is either a) the user that logged into Maintenix - pushed into the database from the client or b) if the record update is not via a Maintenix application, the user is the Oracle user name that is processing the transaction.
